skill.name: screen-reader-testing
skill.description: Test web applications with screen readers including VoiceOver, NVDA, and JAWS. Use when validating screen reader compatibility, debugging accessibility issues, or ensuring assistive technology support.

skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only instructional content for screen reader testing. Contains no executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. All static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting documentation patterns.

content.value_statement: Screen reader issues are hard to reproduce and validate. This skill gives clear test steps and fixes for VoiceOver, NVDA, JAWS, and TalkBack.
actual_capabilities: Provide platform specific setup steps for VoiceOver, NVDA, JAWS, and TalkBack
Offer command references for navigation, forms, and landmarks
Supply checklists for headings, links, forms, and dynamic content
Show accessible patterns for modals, live regions, and tabs
Include debugging tips for accessible name and state
limitations: Does not run screen readers or automate tests
Does not cover every screen reader or browser combination
Does not validate visual design or color contrast

use_cases.title: Manual regression pass
use_cases.description: Run repeatable screen reader checks before a release.

use_cases.title: Fix ARIA issues
use_cases.description: Debug missing announcements and focus behavior in components.

use_cases.title: Team test guide
use_cases.description: Standardize screen reader testing coverage across teams.

prompt_templates.title: Start with VoiceOver
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a VoiceOver test checklist for my landing page with headings, landmarks, and forms.

prompt_templates.title: NVDA quick audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me an NVDA script to test a checkout form, including error handling and focus movement.

prompt_templates.title: Dynamic content checks
prompt_templates.prompt: List steps to verify live region announcements for search results updates.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced widget review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my tab and modal behavior and list the critical screen reader checks to run.

output_examples.input: Provide a checklist to test a modal dialog with NVDA.
output: Confirm the dialog title and description are announced on open
Verify focus moves into the dialog and is trapped inside
Check that Escape closes the dialog and focus returns
Ensure all buttons announce role and state

output_examples.input: What VoiceOver commands help test heading structure?
output: VO + Cmd + H to jump to next heading
Use Rotor (VO + U) to navigate by headings category
Verify all section headings are discoverable

best_practices: Test with real screen readers on supported platforms
Use semantic HTML before adding ARIA
Verify keyboard only flow before screen reader tests
anti_patterns: Relying on a single screen reader for approval
Testing only happy paths without errors

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is plain guidance and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It is manual guidance and does not run tests or automate screen readers.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my test pipeline?
faq.answer: It provides steps and checklists you can adapt into your QA process.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides instructions and sample patterns.

faq.question: What if NVDA or VoiceOver results are inconsistent?
faq.answer: Verify browser, mode, and focus behavior, then retest with the listed commands.

faq.question: How does it compare to automated a11y tools?
faq.answer: It covers real screen reader behavior that automated tools cannot fully detect.
